Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION!!!!! ON THE BEACH”
Reviews.Author: BEACHTRAVELER648
Reviews.Content: Make sure when in Puerto Rico, you make it out to Rincon, about 2hours outside of San Juan, great town, great beaches and stay at Villa Cofressi great family owned hotel right on the beach, very lively on the weekends, good bar food and make sure you order a Pirata drink in the coconut absolutely delish!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! rooms outdated but nice and clean and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Resort style fun with a film festival!”
Reviews.Author: D2theWest
Reviews.Content: Escaped to Rincon and had a great stay at the resort. Nice outside bar, music, great cocanut drinks, awesome view of the ocean. And a super friendly staff to boot! I was there in April and was lucky to find that the Rincon International Film Festival was showing day screenings in the resort. I even got to catch two Sundance films! It was awesome! This added so much fun for me and my friends. You really can't go wrong with the Cofresi. It's a great little get-away, tucked into surf town Rincon.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: brian61982
Reviews.Content: Found this place by accident while visiting Rincon. Everyone was so helpful and friendly. There is an outside bar where you can sit, have a nice drink and enjoy the view of the ocean. You can swim in the pool or go in the ocean. The beach was very clean. The rooms are a little outdated but they are clean and well maintained. Nice restaurant for the free breakfast or for a nice quiet dinner. Great place for families or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Never left the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NanaBoop
Reviews.Content: We just spent our Anniversary weekend at the Villa Confresi. We had such a great time we never left the hotel all weekend. The pool, open bar and Lobby, food and service was amazing. It was also located right on the beach....why would we leave. We plan on going back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelChic
Reviews.Content: Went to Rincon for a dive trip with Taino Divers.. and found this lil treasure. We arrived late, in the dark, and didn't see the property, til morning. It's gorgeous! The rooms are nice, the service is great! The restaurant, bar area, overlooks the ocean, and has music in the evenings. There's lots to do for everyone.. pool tables, foosball, telescopes, and a nice swimming pool. The beach is beautiful, and chairs are provided. There's a breakfast buffet, but we were leaving early to go diving, and would be gone before it started... so a healthy lil sack of goodies, was left for us at the desk, to take with us. Now that's great service!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, good price”
Reviews.Author: D_Anne4
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Villa Confresi after dark. Although the hotel sign on the main road wasn't too easy to see, once I got to the hotel I was very pleased. There is a nice bar/restaurant where you can look over the water. Our waiter Luis directed us to surfing lessons for the next day! Continental breakfast was available, and the hotel was not crowded at all. We had an ocean view room with a large balcony. The room was nice, but there was a very strong air freshener plugged in the bathroom...even after unplugging it, the smell stayed. I was on the 3rd floor, and I don't remember seeing an elevator...this isn't a problem if you only have one bag, but for a longer stay it would be inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Villa Cofresi!”
Reviews.Author: Kitsy P
Reviews.Content: The Villa Cofresi is located on a beautiful beach. The hotel staff is friendly and our room was large, clean and had a lovely view of the ocean. The outdoor bar/ grill area is a constant hub of activity. We enjoyed the atmosphere and the famed coconut filled beverages. If you like to go to sleep early, or are a light sleeper, you might request a room that does not front on the bar area, as it is quite noisy till 11 or 12. The town of Rincon is fun. You can go to many of the surfing areas nearby whether to surf or be a spectator. We went sailing and snorkeling with "Katarina sailing Adventures". I would recommend this as a relaxing day on the water. The crew was professional and fun and the food and drink, included in the price, were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people but the hotel needs work”
Reviews.Author: BeachDLT-50
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Rincon for the first time last month for a surfing vacation. A friend recommended the Villa Cofresi. The hotel is a family owned and operated establishment. There is certainly a welcoming, friendly atmosphere that is promoted here. We met many families that return year after year that seemed very happy with the hotel. Iâ€™m trying my best to be optimistic about this place and we usually overlook minor details that disappoint us, but in this instance, there are just too many to ignore. The positive: First and foremost the staff is very friendly and accommodating (genuinely nice people). The rates are quite reasonable. The bar is one of the nicest in Rincon (right on the beach / amazing sunsets). Monday night (Gringo night is a lot of fun, great band) Pirate special (Rum / Kahlua drink served in a fresh coconutâ€¦how often do you see a bartender swinging a machete behind a bar?). Spacious rooms with large balconies. Thereâ€™s an electronic safe in the room. Housekeeping is quite thorough and does a nice job. Nice large umbrellas are available for loan to take with you when you visit another beach (nice touch). The negative: During the course of our weeklong stay, we had one hot shower. (No hot water on any evening of our stay) The air conditioner made a LOT of noise (screeching sound, we requested that it be repaired; they attempted to fix it but were unsuccessful). Outside noise makes it difficult to get a good nightâ€™s sleep. Friday through Monday, if you go out for dinner, you wonâ€™t have a parking spot when you return. Friday, Saturday and Sunday nights the bar fills with locals (not guests of the hotel). There isnâ€™t much beach and there arenâ€™t enough lounge chairs. Thereâ€™s no break at this hotel, you have to drive about ten minutes away to find surf. Thereâ€™s a shortage of beach towels. Intermittent wifi (it rarely worked in the room but in the lobby it always worked). The free breakfast is adequate, but could be better. (They offer one type of fruit per day, no yogurt and no granola. If you want eggs they charge you $6. They only use paper and plastic. The paper coffee cups are a little bit bigger than a shot glass.) No gym. Bottom line: We enjoyed our stay and the people there are really nice, but we wonâ€™t return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “My every year selection”
Reviews.Author: Sharili
Reviews.Content: I stay there almost every year, they bring good service. The rooms are very clean, the beach its right next to your room, the view its beautiful, the food is good. I just loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, good price, extremely noisy”
Reviews.Author: Brian P
Reviews.Content: At first glance this hotel has it all. Beautiful location, on the beach, great bar with music, towel service, jet ski rental, full beach view, clean, and friendly. Sounds great and we definetely enjoyed ourselves however the bar noise can be unbearable. On weekends plan on not sleeping before midnight. It seems that the place is bar first and hotel second. We loved being on the beach and enjoyed the bar and restaraunt during the day but because of the night noise we will not be returning to stay. If you want good service and beach front, this place can work but be aware of the noise. It seems there is one quieter building and we tried to ask for it but we were told our room would be quiet enough. Looking around I don't see how any of the rooms in the main building could be quiet. I believe there are other great places to stay in Rincon and visit this hotel for the lively bar and beach atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Nicho128
Reviews.Content: We flew almost 3000 miles to the Villa Cofresi and we were not disapointed. Every request was met with a smile and the staff was very helpful and friendly. Steps from the ocean and a great bar. Our last day we got to watch 2 whales jumping out of the ocean right in front of the hotel for the better part of 2 hours. WE WILL BE BACK !

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Beach Vacation”
Reviews.Author: CdnAnn
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a 10 day stay at the Villa Cofresi. To put it simply, we LOVED this hotel. The room we stayed in was a deluxe ocean view king and I must admit, I was pleasantly surprised by how nice it was. The room was very large and very clean, with a big balcony over-looking the ocean. One of the things that struck me was that there was no musty smell that you often find in hotel rooms when you travel to the Caribbean. Housekeeping was great and any requests from the front desk ( i.e. extra pillows) were handled promptly and courteously. We didn't have the problem with noise from the bar that some of the reviewers mention but that was becuase we were in the section of the hotel that is farthest away from the bar- it is definitely worth the $$ to book one of these rooms if you can. Speaking of the bar- what a blast! The bartenders are really fun and friendly and the service was great. You must try the pirata special that everyone talks about- yummy and STRONG. We ate lunch every day at the hotel bar and the food was delicious. The more formal restaurant at the hotel is ok but there are so many funky, beachy places to eat in Rincon that we went off property every night for dinner. The service at the hotel was top notch and we felt very welcomed and "at-home" from the moment we arrived until the moment we left. As many reviewers have stated, this isn't the Ritz or the Four Seasons. However, if you want a casual, laid back hotel right on the beach the Villa Cofresi is a wonderful choice.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaToronto
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel less the second time I stayed there. Originally I was charmed by the friendly, low-key atmosphere, affordable beachfront rooms, fun bar scene and spectacular sunset views. Those are the pluses. But for me the general condition of the grounds and bar area was a turn-off. It's just a bit too shabby and grimy... Tables and furniture that needed a thorough cleaning, the smell of stale food and spilled drinks in the bar, tiles with too much built up dirt. The public areas did not feel clean enough ( the rooms however were spotless). Not a disaster though, just distracting. The restaurant needs healthier food options on the menu, and the included breakfast had so much processed food that we ended up eating elsewhere. However for affordable beachfront it is a great option for a few days. Great for families as the rooms are large.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous beach,relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Formerbrit
Reviews.Content: Rooms away from main building are really nice and peaceful. Only problem in the entire weeks stay was the people at the reception desk. They tried to totally ignore customers acting as if whatever was happening on their computer screens was more important. Everything else was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “We thought it was great but if you don't like noise and parties its not for you.”
Reviews.Author: jmeds
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here last year, we thought it was great. The rooms were big, but remember that you are right on the beach so the rooms are a little musty, but that is to be expected. There is a beautiful beach bar on the beach of this property, it is open to everyone including locals, it becomes exteremely raucous and loud, we loved it and had a great time meeting and hanging out with the locals, however if you are looking for relaxation and quiet, this is not the place for you .

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: bmisec2
Reviews.Content: What a great place...tons of fun...beautiful beach...great food and the happy hour was a blast

Reviews.Title: “The best vacations ever!”
Reviews.Author: elsie g
Reviews.Content: Me and my family needed a place to have a small vacation before returning to work. A place where I could forget about the things I left at home and have a good time simply doing nothing and I found it in Villa Cofresi. We had an apartment with everything we needed at hand. Personel were very friendly and at all times made us feel happy and welcomed. Everthing in the room was working well and in very good conditions. We decided to do tourism in the town and visited every spot we could go to and had the best vacations of our lives in our own country. Definately we will return back as soon as possibleÂ¡

Reviews.Title: “Great Sunsets-Happening Bar”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyCathy
Reviews.Content: Originally planned to stay here but no room's available. Booked another place and unfortunately was over booked. Headed over to Villa Cofresi to rent some jet skis and on a chance asked if anything was available. Luck for us they had a couple of open rooms. We took two 2nd level pool side. One for my husband and I, and the other for our two sons (20-21). The rooms were clean and large. Rooms had balcony's overlooking the pool, bar and beach. The bar got crowded just before sunset, as the sunset was spectacular from the deck, and stayed busy till 12:00-1:00 am. The beach had some small waves and was good for swimming and jet skiing. Surf beaches about a mile away. Good location restaurants and bars, though this appears to be the place most will come to at night. Loved it but when I go back I will chose a room farther from the bar - it can be loud at night.

Reviews.Title: “Best room on the beach...”
Reviews.Author: PetuniaPig
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have been going to this hotel for many years and have found it more than satisfactory. Our balcony is very close to the beach so at night we can hear the ocean. We are far from the bar area so the music and noise are not a bother. The room is quite large with 2 big beds, a nice sitting area with a table and chairs, a big closet, a huge dresser with the tv, a refrigerator, and in the entryway is a dressing table with mirror. The bathroom has a tub. The balcony is spacious with a table and 2 chairs. When we have asked for anything extra in our room it was quickly taken care of and delivered. The breakfast, which comes with the room, is adequate with omlettes available for a small price. It is served buffet style and you can eat your breakfast just yards from the water. The service for dinner is more sketchy but always with politeness and a smile.The food is good. The pool is not large but also adequate. The water is cold--at least I find it so. The ocean is just a step away and usually warmer. All of the years we have been going there the water is a bit wavy which the kids of all ages seem to enjoy. I am looking forward to this years stay in February.

Reviews.Title: “Not our cup of rum - but ok for partiers...”
Reviews.Author: JFel
Reviews.Content: If you like a pool table, karaoke scene the bar is a nice, clean option. We did not stay in the hotel but stopped by for drinks and appetizers. Unfortunately the not very tropical famous pirate coconut drink, along with some unappetizing food made my stomach turn. The pool tables and location were wonderful though. Couldn't imagine staying here with kids unless the rooms are soundproof.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Charles B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Villa Cofresi for three nights Thursday- Sunday, in Mid December. The hotel is clean, comfortable, safe, well maintained and overall, really pleasant. The staff is friendly and helpful. You really get the feeling that this hotel wants to treat you right and to come back. Most of the guests are local families and couples on vacation and they were really nice people to be around. I think I was one of the few solo travelers. My room was spacious and comfy with a balcony that had an amazing view overlooking the sea. I had one small issue with my room (window handle not working) and it was attended to and fixed immediately! The hotel has a great, open air bar overlooking the beach with friendly and entertaining bartenders who looked after me and the other guests. There's Puerto Rican music, salsa dancing and karaoke. It was a very cool, authentic scene of locals and tourists. Very good food too! All this,overlooking the sea. The hotel beach is great; it has sand, is not crowded at all, is good for swimming and faces west for beautiful sunsets. There are shops, restaurants and other beaches within short walking distance. I don't drive but I have to say that Rincon is a town that definitely drives and I think it's best to have a car if you're spending more than two days there. If you tend to go to bed early and want quiet nights be sure to ask for a quiet room in advance. The bar party scene lasts till about midnight but there are rooms that don't face the bar. I stayed in one and it was fine. Anyway, the music they play is great Puerto Rican and Caribbean music. I'm from New York, home to a large Puerto Rican community but there was still a lot of great music I'd never heard before. Definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: Momohat
Reviews.Content: Arrived mid day on a Wed. Had booked the deluxe ($350) suite on the ocean to have quiet and comfort ala reviews. The employee who showed us to our room looked and acted as if he'd slept in his clothes for several nights. No English. Dirt balls on the stairs, wrappers on the floor in the hall. Our room: smelled like the old furniture that was there; broken acoustic tiles perched akimbo in the ceiling; the AC was barely attached to the wall- tape holding parts together; the handle of a window came off in my hand when I tried to open it; there was a shag rug that could have been really dirty or made of foam rubber. Our hearts sank with the thought of actually staying-sleeping there cause it felt so depressed. AND we'd just paid in full. The good news: 1)We stayed next door at Rincon of the Seas ($249 incl FULL breakfast and $25 gift to a lovely restaurant). It seemed like heaven. And 2) Cofresi refunded our total without a problem. The place felt desolate and BADLY in need of almost everything.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: 09beachlovers
Reviews.Content: While beach hopping on our vacation we visited this resort and ended staying here instead. The staff was extemely friendly and the rooms were very clean. If you are short (like my wife) getting into the tub type jacuzzi can be a fun challenge. Just hanging at the bar every afternnon watching the sunset was worth it. It's a short drive to Cabo Rojo where you can get some great local food.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Helpful”
Reviews.Author: haddy0
Reviews.Content: This is a good, well run hotel with pleasant and helpful staff. just know that this is not a "five star" place but rather a laid back, kick back kind of place. I stayed there with a buddy on 10/25 and 10/26 2011. Our room (317) was very large and adequately appointed. There is a very large very private balcony that overlooks the sea directly below. We were on the top floor and during a late afternoon downpour the noise of the rain on the roof was deafening....but if you like that sort of sound it was also kind of exciting. Noise from the bar which sits in the open air center of this horseshoe shaped place was not a problem in this room....so definitely ask for a similarly situated room if loud music at night is a problem for you. The cooking at dinner was exceptionally good, I thought, given the "out of the way" location of Rincon. The breakfasts though were disappointing with little selection and poor presentation. Many local families with small preschoolers seemed to be staying there at this time of the year. So if little kids running around is an issue be aware of this. The hotel was not difficult to find. We drove a rental from San Juan airport and got there in about 2 hours. I was especially grateful that the hotel staff was very understanding and helpful with a major problem. My buddy had come to Rincon for scuba diving opportunities. The three dive shops in the town that we knew of were not operating at this time of the year. When we heard that there was diving going on off Guanica and La Perguera about an hour south, I asked to leave the hotel two days early. My prepaid money was cheerfully and quickly refunded using my credit card. This is a good choice for families and those looking to relax and have some drinks and some fun in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Sunset”
Reviews.Author: gitanamundo
Reviews.Content: I stayed there a while ago for just one night as i have always wanted to go there. We ate at the restaurant on the deck for dinner under the stars and the food was good. We also had breakfast, which was included in the rate ( i think it was a continental breakfast) but for an extra $6 you could add eggs which I found very nice. The bar area is also very nice and it fills up with locals during the night. I would definetely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A slice of paradise”
Reviews.Author: aprince707
Reviews.Content: We "discovered" this charming hotel driving through Rincon. While the Villa is a bit on the dated side, one could not ask for a better location. Our extra large room on the second floor had a balcony overlooking both the beach and ocean, The sunset was phenomenal! The outdoor bar was delightful. The ocean is approximately 15 feet from the end of the bar and the water was great! The staff were very friendly and helpful. While I am not sure if we will ever be in Rincon again, if we do, I know where we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay and hang out”
Reviews.Author: Aliris N
Reviews.Content: this hotel was awesome, its right on the beach. Other than its great location, the night life and atmosphere there is great, so you dont even need to leave to have a good time. They have a drink called "pirata" which is made in a coconut! you wont find this in another place on the island!

Reviews.Title: “Charming romantic hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Eve26
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this charming hotel located right on the beach, we stayed in a standard king room with an ocean view on the third floor. Prior to booking we were made aware that they did not have an elevator-there is a bell man who can bring your bags up. The room was bright airy, very clean and spacious. There was a refrigerator in the room an unexepected plus. The pool was clean and closes in the early evening as I recall about 7 pm-the pool towels the hotel provides are plentiful and thick.We are able to walk along the beach or swim in clear clean beautful water, it was hard to decide bewteen the pool and the ocaen both were so inviting. The bar tenders were fun, helpful and entertaining and offered many inventive cocktails. We felt comfortable walking around the area ,the main road outside the hotel is very busy, and it can be hard to walk along the side of the road so bring a flashlight if you are planning to leave the property to walk around at night. Yes the music was loud at night but we expected this, we enjoyed the music, dancing and positve engery of the crowd before we went to bed. The festivities lasted beyond our bedtime but not so long that we were unable to get to sleep. Dinner in the hotel was good , nice meal selections, which were well served. The breakfast selections were a little disappointing though the coffee and bread were excellent.I highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: crimsonchik_apo
Reviews.Content: we spent the night here after the wedding. the room was adequate and we were fortunately not not trying to sleep when there was loud music. bed was comfortable and i liked that balcony over the water, even if it was basic. breakfast was served downstairs and was quite good. the one bad thing was that no one warned us that water pressure was off for the whole area of beach (just had had ts otto), and when we went to shower there wasnt any water. we called but no one answered. we asked sandra in the morning and she told us that the person that watches the phone also does a few security checks, so maybe we should have called a few times.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE ROOM, GREAT VIEW & GREAT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: tlocations
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Confresi as a get away and we are so glad we did. This was a wonderful hotel. I would suggest the fresh Coconut Rum drinks at the outside bar. There was wonderful music, great sunset and we made new friends. I would suggest requesting one of their rooms with a bathtub because there are only a few. The room itself was one of the largest rooms I have stayed in and it was overlooking the ocean. You can walk the beach for miles.

Reviews.Title: “My stay/experience at Villa Cofresi was simply magnificant!”
Reviews.Author: oceanlove413
Reviews.Content: I've been to many hotels in my lifetime, but my stay/experience at Villa Cofresi was simply magnificant! The moment I arrived, I was greeted by a professional team wearing smiles that could light up any room. As we all know, customer-service is extremely important and it could either make or break a business. Trust me when I tell you, this team of professionals go above and beyond the call of duty to ensure their guests are taken care and happy! Cleanliness is another extremely important factor and my room was cleaned to perfection and I enjoyed a breath-taking ocean view! The atmosphere is fun and lively! It is truly contagious...I was immediately transported to a relaxed, fun, tropical vibe. Ahhhhhhh just what I needed to jump start my vacation since I had just arrived from the hustle and bustle of New York City...and the food! OMG - the food is soooooooo good!!!!!! Everything is fresh and cooked to perfection! I will return to Villa Cofresi and I will share with my friends and family this unique gem on the beach! Oh, before I forget, I must respond to the review written by this "Elsa Lopez" woman who wrote on July 16 and who sent a picture of a broken window handle...to her I ask Really? Seriously? You must be a very unhappy, miserable person and to people like her I say: Stay at a mountain top away from happiness! O.K. I feel better now. I highly recommend the Villa Cofresi! It was a magical experience. Thank you ; )

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: elsaflopez1
Reviews.Content: First, parking is a problem and u need a car,unless u cab it all the time. Too many rooms and not enough parking spots for guests. Noisy is an understatement! I was aware of the music but if u have this problem,update the windows to be sound proof. Talking about windows, handles were broken,not that I wanted to open them! Coffee pot cracked, really, how hard is it to get this taken care of,it really needs major renovation!! major!!. Breakfasts was below average, worth skipping, coffee cold, bread hard, and extra if u wanted eggs! Isn't that part of a breakfast buffet,if u can call it that,not!!!.Pool, sooooo small that is not worth even looking at!. Being from there,Puerto Rico, I will NEVER stay or recommend this place to ANYONE,no matter how much I dislike the person! Stay next door,Rincon by the Sea,much better! As a flight attendat ,I've been in many,many hotels and by far this has been the WORST!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at a great price”
Reviews.Author: lilai8
Reviews.Content: Rincon is amazing and Villa CofresÃ­ is awesome!! It is truly a family owned hotel and they take great care of you. I grew up visiting with my family and now as an adult I brought my kids and was pleasantly surprised. The rooms are great, up to date, clean. They have activities for adults, teenagers as well. The "pirata" drink (in the coconut) is unique and you keep wanting more. The view is priceless and the price reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place right on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: yogidog13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and had a great time. Room was large and very clean. We enjoyed having a balcony overlooking the water. Great sunsets. The bar was fun at night. Food was good rum drink in a coconut even better! Staff was very nice. No complaints. We thought we lost our credit card on site and everyone was very helpful in searching for it. They took our number so they could call if they found it , as we had to leave. We ended up finding it in a pair of shorts that had been packed away in the bottom of suitcase. Thanks again to the owner and staff for a great vacation stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what the hub bub is all about”
Reviews.Author: debavaAmarilloTX
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here last week. It was ok. I'm not sure what all the hub bub is about. the room was large, bathrooms small. All was clean - but don't leave any food or snacks out due to tiny ants that find it instantly. We did pay extra for a balcony room, which was nice and very private, right on the water. Their beach is tiny. The bar area is open to the beach, and that is nice. But there was so much hype to get their famous coconut drink - of course we had to try them. My husband liked his, but I did not like mine. The drinks are not made fresh for each. I watched them make it and they take whatever was left over from the last person and either add to it, or toss 1/2 out and make more. The bartender uses a straw to test the old batch to see how much he has to throw out. In just 2 hours, I saw him do this 3 times. The bar food was good snack food though, the restaurant prices seemed high. you get a continental breakfast, and we were told that for an additional 5.99 we could get 2 eggs also. A little pricey for 2 eggs, in my opinion. the maid did not clean the coffee pot nor leave us more coffee. Internet was spotty at best, if you went to the main area, it was better. This hotel is ok - but I don't think I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Treasure on the beach.....”
Reviews.Author: atwin26
Reviews.Content: Great location with excellent service. The management and staff went out of their way to make our stay memorable. Everthing was perfect.....rooms (great balcony ocean view), exceptional food, beach/water sports, and amazing sunsets. If you want to explore, there are many activities and local restaurants nearby. It truely is a "little bit of paradise" and we will surely return.

Reviews.Title: “get treated like a VIP”
Reviews.Author: steelersmario
Reviews.Content: The hotel Villa Cofresi is a wonderful place for relaxation, great authentic food, awesome service. This family run resort is very clean and well maintained. The owners Sandra and Tito will treat you like family! It appears to have a nice combination of American tourists during the week and a local hangout on the weekends. It is very close to town if you want to sample local restaurants and has lots of water activities. We definitely plan to vacation there again! Charm and Mario

Reviews.Title: “A very wonderful place.”
Reviews.Author: WorldWonderer77
Reviews.Content: Had planned to stay 2 days here, but we liked it so well we stayed 4 perfect days. We had an efficiency that only cost about $100 a night which is a great price for a place right on the beach. The room maid bent over backwards to make sure we had everything we needed. Would have liked to stay there forever.

Reviews.Title: “Another enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: jef013
Reviews.Content: Visited for five nights post cruise stay as we did last year. I really like this part of Puerto Rico that is very restful although the hotel is at times is busy due to the popular bar. The accommodation is not luxury but more than adequate and clean. Our room looked over the ocean so we could sit on the balcony and watch the sunset having a pre dinner drink. The hotel restaurant is excellent with nothing fancy but beautiful grilled steaks, chops etc plus other fish dishes and local dishes. If I have to give one negative its the bar on busy nights where trying to get a drink is hard work with the bar staff more inclined to play to the people than serving drinks.

Reviews.Title: “our second home!”
Reviews.Author: ticopuebla
Reviews.Content: We leave tomorrow for the wonderful Hotel Villa Cofresi, our 40th year at the Villa. Years ago we came with our mothers, now we bring our grandkids.... This is THE place to be if your idea of a great vacation is lounging on a lovely beach, being helped by a cheerful and caring staff, and having the mesmerizing sound of the surf lull you to sleep every night. The comp. breakfast buffet is terrific, and the Villa provides beach towels and comfy beach lounges.....Long live the Caro family, owners of this enchanting Caribbean gem!

Reviews.Title: “not bad but also not the best”
Reviews.Author: domnl
Reviews.Content: There is a lot of choice but good quality has its price and I did not want to pay an insult to my budget so we ended up here, in a family room with two doubles on a quiet side of the hotel. Location is nice: beachfront. Pool is small but what do you need that for with all that beach... Room is large and quiet indeed. bathroom also large but not luxurious. Beds OK but old fashioned blankets are outdated, mattresses are not comfortable. Breakfast was poor in quality and choice. Free internet in the lobby worked at times. General guests are noisy party people. quality/price comparison: not the best value.

Reviews.Title: “The Villa Cofresi is simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Nicho128
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 20th anniversay in Rincon Puerto Rico at the Villa Cofresi. We could not have selected a better place to stay. Every detail was top notch including their wonderful restaraunt. We had 3 meals their including a Valentines buffet that was out of this world. Most dishes were around $20 and were simply gourmet. Of couse their location was also second to none. A western sunset evernight that coincided with happy hour at the bohio. The staff was equally pleasant in english as well as spanish. Again top notch. My wife and I agreed that this was our best vacation ever and we owe much of that to the family and staff at the Villa Cofresi. We booked right away for next year. Hasta Pronto !!

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous time at Villa Cofresi”
Reviews.Author: raymiesgirl
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th time at Villa Cofresi, I just love it!! The staff are so friendly and go out of thier way to make your stay and enjoyable one. They have all become like an extended family to me. We fly into Aguadilla and get a cab, but everything is in walking distance and you really don't even have to leave if you want to eat at the restaurant or bar every night. The breakfast is included and has a great varity of choices. They offer Salsa lessons, Kareoke, yoga and have entertainment on weekends and Monday nights. Everything is so clean and they are constantly making improvements. There are fancier places around but I wouldn't change a thing as this family owned hotel makes you feel like you are part of them. The sunsets are outstanding and the tropical breezes, spanish music and gorgeous weather all add to this relaxing atmosphere and keeps us coming back. Puerto Rico is definately the "Enchanted Island" as they say. Thanks again Rita, Sandy and all the staff at Villa Cofresi, we will be back next year God willing!!

Reviews.Title: “needs alot of work.”
Reviews.Author: rndeb11
Reviews.Content: After a week cruise looking foward to a few more beach days. 4 nights here in Rincon. First impression good, then went to our room... Room large with balcony overlooking beach. Bathtub broken, this fixed the first night. (grouting needs some major work). Room telephone jack pulled out of wall, this took 2 days to fix. Door to balcony would not close, this was never fixed. Do not expect you room to be cleaned much before 3-4pm. Always asking for extra towels for bathroom. Cleaning supplies and dirty laundry left in piles outside of rooms for a couple hours before being picked up. Bed linens not changed in 4 nights. I you walked down hall to ice machine and did not wear shoes, you feet would be black. Beach ok, but watch oout for glass. Ok hotel needs alot of TLC, will not be staying here againand will not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “My Daughters wedding dream come true”
Reviews.Author: logannagaubo
Reviews.Content: We celebrated My daughters wedding at Villa cofresi on January 2 2011, We were checked into a room on the third floor that was very spacious and comfortable. The hotel is right on the water therefore making it the perfect wedding destination, the sunsets on this part of the island are a sight to see, there for this is the perfect place to be if you enjoy spectacular sunsets. Our daughter held her wedding at the garden area of the hotel and we were almost rained out until Sandra the hotel top executive came to the rescue with weather satellite information to the point of making a disisive move to have the wedding continue as planed out doors, she was really great making this happen for our daughter, she also helped a great deal with the setting up of the ballroom for the event. What a trooper you are Sandra.. I want to thank you as well as Edgardo the wedding decorator and the entire hotel staff. Sandra Knows that we will be back. Jose and Rosalyn

Reviews.Title: “Surprised by its charm”
Reviews.Author: maggieandchester
Reviews.Content: Went off season and got a good rate day of check in. Not the most comfortable beds, but at least we had two big king sized beds and a pull out couch for the kids. Very happy with the location as it was on the water, with a nice beach and pool and the outdoor bar served a good lunch of hot dogs, hamburgers and chicken kebabs. Definitely a pleasant surprise and quite charming.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: wilk1020
Reviews.Content: The staff here make the difference. Hope they got extra money for all they effort . Is the same beach to Villa Antonio and Rincon of the Seas( staff here is not so happy) Very clean hotel, nothing fancy but you fill like in home!

Reviews.Title: “One of our best vacations ever”
Reviews.Author: ProfLonghair
Reviews.Content: Our family just got back from perhaps our best vacation ever and in large part this was due to staying at the Villa Cofresi. We absolutely loved this hotel. It was recommended to us by one of my students who is from Puerto Rico. This is a family-owned hotel that Puerto Ricans love going to. It is a great way to immerse yourself in the Puerto Rican culture. The hotel is right on the beach in laid-back Rincon, famous for holding a world surfing championship long ago. Our 6 days at the Villa Cofresi were incredibly relaxing. The hotel has perhaps 80 rooms or so. Most are built around a U-shape, opening to the ocean. Also within the U are the small pool, outdoor seating, and the outdoor bar. This is a great gathering area, with music going all day and salsa dancing/karaoke/live music going on in the evenings. We had asked for a room away from this area and our Deluxe room on the 2nd of 3 floors was facing the ocean on a newer extension (a double U?) of the buiding. However, it also would have been fun to have a room on the inner side, depending on whether you want to listen to the music until 11 or so. As the sun goes down, the lighting on this coutyard is fantastic...incredibly romantic. We ate a number of dinners out in the courtyard. The restaurant, which serves dinners, is fantastic. I think that many of the locals come for the steaks and seafood, but we usually had one of the Puerto Rican dishes. You can get lunch outside through the bar, which grills up great hamburgers and tostones (fried bananas, similar to fries). They make these great Pirate Specials---basically pina colladas served in a coconut. They machete the fresh coconut right there, slashing down towards the coconut with their hand underneath the coconut--don't try this at home. Fantastic! The quick, basic breakfasts are fantastic for families. I read some negative comments about the breakfasts, but you must remember that the breakfasts ARE FREE! Personally, I like eating on paper plates. They have cereals, sweet rolls, bagels and cream cheese, breads that many people used to make breakfast sandwiches with the cheese and ham, usually a frozen waffle or pancake that you can heat up, fruits, fruit juices, delicious coffee. And, did I mention that this was FREE?! We missed the free classes on Yoga and salsa dancing, as well as a magician that was there on Mondays. I would guess that about 90 percent of the people staying there spoke spanish, which for us, made the vacation more cultural and meaningful. We later stayed 4 days at a large resort on the east coast, where 90% of the guests spoke english, and it just was not the same. (The people working at the Villa Cofresi are bilingual.) Above everyting else, the service was fantastic...we felt like family. This included housekeeping, front desk, waiters, bar people...everybody. In fact, the owner's son taught my 10 year old how to boogie board, which was an added bonus. Overall, this is a very, very well run hotel. We do not know when we will be able to travel back to Puerto Rico, but if we do, we will stay at the Villa Cofresi, without a doubt. Puerto Rico is a fantastic place and we absolutely love the people, particularly those that we met at the Villa Cofresi. Great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service at a homey feeling resort.”
Reviews.Author: AndreaMatias
Reviews.Content: I took my husband and grandson to this small town resort. It was a gem of a find, away from the commercialized bigger cities, it offered quality, service and fun beyond my expectations. It felt like home, real comfortable and welcoming with quality amenities and a variety of entertainment opportunities along with a warm and eager to serve staff. A few yards from the sandy surf we were able to enjoy the pool, lively latin music and their signature Pirate specialty drink served in a hulled coconut, worth a visit in and of itself. My grandson loved the nearby activities, particularly enjoying the banana boat ride and the jetski rentals. He gave it his seal of approval with an "awesome" review when I asked him how he would rate the stay. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable; Four chairs, two full sized beds and a pull out sofabed along with a useful and tidy kitchenette all were well appointed and reset freshly each day by. We started each day rested and then enjoyed the free continental breakfast before heading off for some island fun. If you want to get away from the city, enjoy local flavor and create happy memories for the whole family, we highly recommend Villa Cofresi resort and hotel. The hotel managers Sandra and Rita along with their attentive staff down to our room tending staff of Yahaira and Sonia made us feel like family. We can't wait to go back again. In the mean time we've got wonderful memories of one of the funner and more relaxing vacations we've enjoyed as a family. --Andrea Matias

Reviews.Title: “An Awesome Rincon Experience!”
Reviews.Author: smoreno3
Reviews.Content: After several hours of driving and getting lost coming from the east side of island, we were pleasantly surprised to find a classic paradise resort in Rincon. Parking was simple and check-in was no problem at all. We upgraded to the ocean view overlooking the quiet terrace area and well worth it. The beach bar may easily be one of the best spots on the island with very cool bartenders such as Eddie Vargas slicing coconuts for drinks with machetes. Almost a pirate like experience! Kayaking and jet skis add to the ultimate island resort experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pirate Special”
Reviews.Author: LookKidsTheresBigBen
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few nights in San Juan and decided to break up the trip and drive out west for a night. It was the best idea. Villa Cofresi was perfect for 1 night - on the beach, awesome beach bar, big room overlooking the ocean (the 3rd floor is the best room views). The bartenders were entertaining and made great drinks - including the Pirate Special... Great fried snacks on the road nearby at El Patio Familiar.

Reviews.Title: “Villa CofresÃ­ is like coming home again”
Reviews.Author: rodndtube
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been staying at Villa CofresÃ­ for about 20 years - obviously it would be hard imaging staying anywhere else. It has been a pleasure to watch the Villa expand and improve over the years - there is always something new, whether it is the new pineapple lamps, the tile, renovated rooms and so on. There is always something fresh and exciting. Sadly, this was the last visit staying in our longtime favorite room next to the beach and pool with the view of Little Malibu and Tres Palmas from our porch -- the night time tempo of music and karaoke from the bohio (bar/grill/lounge area) became too much for me since I arise before dawn to go surfing every morning. Even though that will be missed, too. Next year we will be staying in the rooms in the "new" section on the south side of the main complex which is much quieter and have wonderful views of the Caribbean (but not the Little Malibu "indicators" for surf check!). The rooms in this section are both large and small - we will be staying in one of the spacious rooms and I sampled one of these by myself during an April trip for some surfing before heading to San Juan for a class reunion). There are also quiet rooms in the back (near the parking lot). The Villa has a great restaurant, moderately priced, and bohio where you can order up hamburgers, fries, and pinchos. My recommendation is to select the pinchos - burgers are available everywhere, but pinchos are not! There are also a few restaurants within walking distance and many more options within a 10-minute drive. Lastly, the hotel management/hosts (Sandra and Rita) represent the best in Borinquen hospitality, and everyone from the bar staff to the restaurant and support staff are wonderful in this family-run and -operated villa. A note on my ratings: I gave the villa 5 star ratings across the board within the context that this is a villa and not a Las Vegas style luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel cramped in at end of dirty , noisy driveway.”
Reviews.Author: njfisherman1817
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Villa Confresi and immediately got very concerned. Lobby was very busy and loud. Went to our room and again were a little disappointed . Windows did not work properly , fridge was leaking water onto floor , bathroom window above bathtub opened onto hallway outside. Went to beach and it was packed with locals with coolers full of Medalla beer , I didn't know P.R. had this much beer on island. After a little observing i put everything together . The locals park on the driveway and walk down a narrow path to the beach. We stayed two nights and checked out , went two doors down to Rincon of the seas resort.

Reviews.Title: “What a fun place!”
Reviews.Author: danind
Reviews.Content: I am an eighteen year old girl and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It is right on the beach, which is not rocky or weedy. And in the evening the sunset is beautiful because it Rincon is right on the western tip of Puerto Rico. The rooms at the Villa Cofresi Hotel were well-kept. They are nothing special or fancy, but they are clean and comfortable. The pool is not very large, and it is closed at night. My favorite part about my stay here was the bar in the evening. You might be thinking, "Typical teenager on spring break," but, trust me, it was a blast. There is usually karaoke, but during my stay there was a DJ. The place was packed and everyone was singing and dancing. The crowd ranged from teenagers to couples to parents with their kids. The atmosphere is fun and the bartenders are hilarious. However it is very loud, so do not expect to go to bed at 8 o'clock. They close the bar at midnight. I did not find much to do in the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: rinc0nl0ver
Reviews.Content: I have grown to love the sleepy surfer town of Rincon mostly because of Villa Cofresi. It's a family run place and you can really tell the staff takes a lot of pride in their hospitality. The lobby terrace connects right onto the hotel bar and the sea front - they're not kidding when they say it's right on the beach. It's not an ideal surfer spot, the waves are too gentle, but it's a 10 minute drive to where the surfers hang out. Everyone is really friendly and 95% of the staff speaks good English (a few of the maids didn't, but we still communicated fine.) We traveled in a group of extended family ranging in age from 2 years old to 88 years old, and there was something for everyone to enjoy their vacation - a relaxed terrace that transforms into a bustling, fun bar scene at night with live music and friendly locals, the ocean and a pool, and a game room with pinball and video games. What's also nice is that if you just want to have a resort experience, everything you need to be comfortable is at the hotel, but if you don't like being in a tourist bubble it's a safe 20 minute walk to the town center of Rincon. The locals are friendly and it's a chance to experience every day life in Rincon. Also, there's a supermarket and a very good organic market on the way, and if you really want a taste of the exotic on your vacation, right at the hotel gate there's a botanica (a Santeria supply shop with candles and magic charms) and the English-fluent owner is happy to show you around and have you listen to some of his collection of Afro-Cuban world music. If there was one thing I would change it's that policies and check-ins were a little confused because there's not uniform communication between staff (for example, there was some confusion when we checked in because a wrong name was on our reservation) But other than that I am looking forward to the next time we can visit and experience paradise again. I love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: JulieAlicea
Reviews.Content: This is place is fantastic, I loved every minute of it and hope to go back asap. The sunsets here are incredible, the staff went out of their way to please you. The music from the bar made me feel like dancing all night long, at home I am in bed by 9 pm. the rates were so reasonable and the place was spacious and clean. I would love to have my daughter's wedding there in the fall. Kudos to the owners and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our initial impressions”
Reviews.Author: SUVG
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at Villa Cofresi, we were on day 3 of torrential rain, and it seemed like a fraternity party was in full swing. We had come from Hacienda Del Mar in Dorado, so this hotel seemed so much smaller (it is) and louder (it is). The reception rooms are all open air, and it seemed that the world and his mother was taking shelter there (as well as hanging out at the bar). I wasn't quite sure what to expect for our two bedroom apartment. It's the one accommodation that is not pictured on the website. Well... we were thrilled. It was lovely. Very airy, nicely furnished and it had a balcony leading out to a terrace with views of the ocean beyond. It was great! Continentall breakfast was included in the rate. For an extra $5, you could eggs. We stayed for three days and the breakfast foods were varied We ate dinner at the restaurant every evening (or at least from the restaurant - we ate outdoors overlooking the water or else had dinner delivered to our room, which was a nice option given the age of our children). The staff are excellent. They were great with our kids and made us feel very welcome. There is no gym. Instead guests are directed to a public gymnasium about 3/4 of a mile away. The hotel is right on the beach. The water is a little rough for small kids, but we all enjoyed walks on the beach. The pool is small, but again perfect for our kids, and there's a pool for toddlers too. The views and the sunsets are beautiful. It was nice hanging on the terrace watching the sun go down while the kids ran around. The bar staff are very nice, and the hotel offers a delicious rum drink served directly from a coconut. The bar opens at 10AM, and that's when the music starts too. Other reviewers commented on the music being too loud. We didn't have a problem sleeping through the din, and our kids were fine too. I'm not sure what time the bar closes. I'm usually out for the count by 9pm anyway. We stayed Sunday thru' Wednesday, and the hotel was not full. Initially we had hoped to stay for the weekend, but given how crowded the place was when we arrived, I'm glad those plans did not work out. We had a lovely stay. If we were in Rincon again, we'd stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “We will be returning to Villa Cofresi”
Reviews.Author: H2Olvr
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 teens and I visited PR for 10 nights in June 2008. We traveled about , staying 2-3 nights in each area of the island. We had lived there (San Juan area 88-94), and our kids were born there, so we are not strangers to PR. The couple of nights we spent at Villa Cofresi were great. We had a large room (king deluxe) with plenty of space for the 4 of us. The beach was beautiful. The Pirate Special served in a fresh coconut, (with more in a glass on the side) was delicious! The sunset view from the bar stool was like heaven. While we sipped our drinks, the kids played pool at the nearby tables. I'm a very light sleeper and we were not bothered by the music or noise at night, even though it was a weekend and the hotel was full. Maybe the room location was perfect. We like salsa music, and we didn't to go to sleep very early anyway. We enjoyed dinner in the restaurant where the food and service was quite good. Continental breakfast is included (it was as good or better than most hotels and you can add eggs cooked to order if you want them). The room was clean. The location excellent. Service was friendly and very good. There's art everywhere including murals of underwater scenes in the halls and mosaics around the columns in the games area. We liked the room, the hotel, and Rincon area so much that we have booked a return trip (for August 2010). This time we will stay all 8 nights at Villa Cofresi in the same room as last time. We will rent a car and do day trips from there. With the fantastic air fare from Orlando to Aguadilla, and reasonable room rates, the trip is a great value too. Puerto Rico is still 5 months away, and I'm already dreaming of scuba diving and snorkeling in the mornings, then that evening coconut rum drink as the music plays and the sun melts into the Caribbean Sea.

Reviews.Title: “De Paseo”
Reviews.Author: MyriamC1
Reviews.Content: Super Cool, long drive fron San Juan But the dirnks where worth it!

Reviews.Title: “NOISY, LOUD & NOISY!”
Reviews.Author: BCGirl64
Reviews.Content: Before you book this hotel you should know that the rooms overlook the bar (they tell you the ocean, but the bar gets between you and that meaningless stretch of water), which blasts - and I mean BLASTS - music from noon until midnight (7 days a week), regardless of whether there are 2 or 10 (never more than that) people left in the bar. As I write this it is 11.30 pm and there is not a place in the hotel where you can escape the sounds of the karaoke machine, even if you had industrial strength earplugs. If you would rather go to the party, rather than have it come to you in your room and regardless of whether you are in the partying mood, then DO NOT STAY HERE. There are so many better hotels on this stretch of beach in the same price range - choose one of them and come here if you want to party - and then leave when you are done.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: Beachy722Maryland
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Puerto Rico. My husband and I stayed in Rincon for five nights in February. We orginally booked at the hotel next to this one, and were very disappointed. After one night at that location, we moved to the Villa Cofresi Hotel, and were pleasantly surprised. Our usual destinations are all-inclusives, and this hotel had a resort feel without the crowds. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were pleasant, and clean, and included a small refrigerator. The pool was small, but clean, and the beach was nice. The beach chairs were well worn, but comfortable enough. Although the beach doesn't have any shade at this location, the hotel will supply a very nice beach umbrella. They also supply beach towels. The sunsets were amazing at this location, and one day we saw whales from the beach. The hotel has a lively bar right on the beach where you can get a reasonably priced lunch from their grill. The bar sports an active night life with many locals coming in for entertainment. The hotel also has a dinner resturant, but we did not try it. A continental breakfest is included with the stay, and we found that there was a nice selection. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The Villa Cofresi is wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: strange
Reviews.Content: It is located on the best beach on the west side or Puerto Rico. The staff is excellent and you will love it. We had an apartment unit on the main floor near the pool. Many of the hotel guests have been returning there for several years. The bar and restaurant are good. The morning breakfast is not the best but it really doesn't matter. Go there and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Love Villa Cofresi!!!”
Reviews.Author: raymiesgirl
Reviews.Content: I love this place, went last year for 2 nights, decided to go again for a week. Went with my sister and we flew into Aguadilla instead of San Jaun. The staff go out of thier way to make your stay special. Jalessa (Sp) and Rita (one of the owners were especially friendly.) but everyone, from waitstaff to maids were extra freindly. We loved the bartenders, don't know all thier names, but Eddie, Chue, ChiChi, and Evie were very entertaining. The hotel offered free Yoga classes, Salsa Classes and had Kareoke on Friday nights, we took advantage of all, except didn't get to Kareoke as I wasn't feeling well that night. We hated having to go home. We went horseback riding on the beach one afternoon and the hotel drove us there and picked us up as we didn't have a car. I can't say enought about this hotel, Its probably the cleanest place I have ever stayed as they are always cleaning!! Hope to get back there soon!!! Love it!!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: jeff013
Reviews.Content: Had a great three nights at this hotel after a weeks cruise on the Advenure of the Seas. the situation of the hotel is great where our room was only around 2 metres from the sea. The room was in reasonable shape where the AC work well plus a decent bath and shower. I must say that we eat in the restaurant on all three nights since the food was excellent. The bar is situated on the patio where the bar staff are ok but they treat you better if you are a 21 year old attractive female. The area around the hotel has a couple of local restaurants but you need a car as you do in Rincon in general. To sum up I would recommend this hotel as good place to base yourself to tour the area or spend lazy days on the beach. The only minus was the bland continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, laid-back beach resort with a good restaurant and first-class service.”
Reviews.Author: Galaleo
Reviews.Content: This is a small gem of the Caribbean! Clean, very well managed, large Deluxe room, clean beach with a moderate surf that you could hear at night. Patio bar is a fun place, but ask for a room away from the bar if you go to bed early. Continental breakfast included and the food was good. Management is on top of things and the staff is polite and upbeat. They can't do enough for you. A great vacation spot for relaxing on or off the beach. Best value in Rincon. Highly recommended. We will be back. Only problem was a noisy air conditioner in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Max150
Reviews.Content: Stayed a full three days had a great time. Areas are kept very very clean and staff was warm and friendly not only at the counter but everywhere we went, pool, bar, beach just very helpful. Great menu, food was excellent you must have dinner there. Also take the time to visit the local area and small shops next to the beaches. There are a few small malls around the area which are very ease to get to. They also have a small shop at the hotel if you need to buy gifts or something you would have forgotten. Checking in and out was like in a large hotel. Overall rating a great get away place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful sunsets”
Reviews.Author: sc00ter44
Reviews.Content: Room was very large with spacious balcony overlooking the ocean. Bathroom was very small but organized well. Our room was on the third floor-no elevator. So you expect great views. Unfortunately noisy beach work was being done right in front of this area. We could not use the garden or get to the beach from here. Since the project seemed to be close to completion, this should not be a problem for future guests. The sunsets are glorious!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, excellant value, excellant location”
Reviews.Author: Pokethebear
Reviews.Content: We originally had reservations at the Lazy Parrot, upon arrival we were informed the bar and restaurant were closed. (when making the reservation we specifically asked if they would be open because we understood it was off season, and were assured they would be open.) We were offered an "upgrade" a moldy, musty smelling room up many flights of stairs. We ran. ...When we arrived at Villa Confresi,what a relief to find a large,airy room with a private patio directly facing the ocean. A friendly and efficient staff, great oceanside Tiki bar with pool tables and Pina Coladas served in fresh coconuts, and a great restaurant. All at very reasonable rates. Thank you Villa Confresi, you saved our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful ocean views that make you forget your worries.”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl1069
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, clean and the staff the friendliest I've ever seen. They make you want to stay. Hearing the ocean waves crash at night is very relaxing. The beach is clean and chairs/umbrellas/beach towels are provided for you. Would definitely recommend people to go to Villa Cofresi!!

Reviews.Title: “The food, service, view was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Mollyb4
Reviews.Content: We were traveling from Milwaukee, WI. Our delight was the beautiful view. Room was extremely comfortable and just off the beach. We had all our meals at the hotel and could not be happier. The surf and beach was so peaceful in the AM again, beautiful. Drinks at the bar were reasonably priced. The vacation was a huge success as a result of this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: mfnyc
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived, it was exactly how I had imagined, nothing fancy, but nice beach location and lowkey atmosphere. We had requested a "quiet", oceanview room. The room was a nice size. At checkin they offered us a beach umbrella to hold on to for our stay, and we gladly accepted. Furnishings are a bit dated, but very clean. Minutes after arriveing in our room, they sent up a gift basket, with fruit, snacks, a t-shirt and a few other things. Needless to say, we thought this was perfect. We arrived on a big holiday weekend in the area (Good Friday/Easter). The hotel was packed, mostly locals (judging by the large number of spanish speakers). The beach was crowded and some groups were on the loud side, with radios blasting. The beach itself though was very nice. The best time of the day with in the morning or late afternoon when it was quieter. We ate our first night (Thursday) at the hotel restaurant. It turned out to be the best food we had while in the area. It's reasonable, and the fish very fresh, I'd gladly recommend it. Breakfast on the other had was pretty awful. Wonder bread, and pre-wrapped american cheese slices, ham, fruit of the day (either apples, plums, kiwi) and some 'danish' (also, in some cases pre-wrapped). There was a toaster and goorge forman grill available. Eggs are available at an extra cost as well. There was some kind of entertainment at the bar that night. Even though we were in the so-called quiet area, we could still here music until around midnight. This is with windows closed and a/c on. Without live entertainment there isn't much noise at all but Saturday night there was a live band, which played until well after midnight. Needless to say we didn't sleep well. We were told we should have called to complain. They said if they get more than 2 complaints they stop the music (I don't know if this is true). The place emptied out on Easter Sunday. The beach was much more peaceful then. Our last night the a/c in our room broke completely. They couldn't fix it but gave us another room to sleep in (we left our things int he first room, just slept in the other room). The other room was more updated (flat screen TV, double sinks in bathroom, nicer linens and a few other more modern touches), but still had the dated furniture, and not as great a view. It was also closer to the bar are, so probably noisier. By the time we checked out we were ready to leave. We ate at various restaurants in the area, but they all disappointed. We did like the beach. If ever we go again, we'd look into maybe a beach property rental or one of the other hotels in the area and do more restaurant research.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Beach Trip”
Reviews.Author: DebzNY
Reviews.Content: We travel to Puerto Rico frequently and have enjoyed the beaches for many years. The sunsets, water and local food keeps us coming back for more every year. This is a very affordable vacation from New York to a warm tropical get away. The Villa is not a high end resort and they do not advertise as one. They are a great beach motel for true beach people. The sunsets are incredible. The bar is a beach bar you would find on any tropical beach. Music lasts until about midnight but the crowd gets quiet after that. The drinks are plentiful and reasonable..They are known for their Pirate drink..I highly recommend it. We rented a car and we ate dinner in many of the restaurants in Rincon. Very, very good places to eat. Plenty of night life if you are looking for it. Lots of local flavor to explore. We went in January and was told the summers are very crowded due to locals enjoying the beach. Erosion has made the width of the beach smaller but still plenty of length for morning, afternoon or evening strolls. I did about and hour of walking everyday. I would not rule this out if you want beach, sun and simple relaxation. This is a very affordable escape! The hotel was clean when we were there and we met many people from New York, New Jersey and Conn. Everyone we met were returnees. We'll be back...To Ring that Bell!

Reviews.Title: “Villa Cofresi: Good & bad!”
Reviews.Author: FF184
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed at the VC for 5 nights in Feb/2009. My wife and I, plus 2 14 y/o girls. The room was 'parking lot view', it was all that was available, and the very nice girl at the reception desk was both straightfoward and apologetic. She would be the last decent employee we met. The room was a good size, but tired and tacky. The facilities are all average/adequete. The beach is small and the beach chairs are old and broken. On weekends, the native PR's come to this beach IN DROVES. The beaches are all public, so you can expect this. We will not return here, or, to PR for that matter. We found the 'natives' arrogant, with a complete lack of customer service. If you don't speak Spanish (I do), you are screwed, since very little attempt is made. I'll spend a little more $, and go to Mexico, where you are treated with decency.

Reviews.Title: “Great quick getaway”
Reviews.Author: moobeth
Reviews.Content: This was my second year going here. Its reasonable and you dont need a car, I get picked up at the airport by Carlos from Rincon tours for $40 and dropped off at the hotel. I am a beach person and just like to relax for the 5 days I was there. This trip the night time noise was a little louder than last year but I still fell asleep. The bartenders are friendly and the drink the Pirate Special is a great happy huor drink. Didnt care for the resurant on the property but eating at the bar during the day was fine. My favorite local spot was across the street where they make the best empanadas and fried plantain on top of a stew. This was a somewhat budget vacation for me so the location was great for meals that were inexpensive. Happy hour is crowded and have 2.25 drink specials you cant beat. You ask for more liquor and they pour it on no questions asked. The pina coladas with a rum floater is to die for. Beach is short but the water is great, Get your chairs early as there were many broken ones. The staff is extrememly helpful and even brought me to the local drug store when I needed to go. People of all ages here so no discrimination and just a nice easy place to visit from NY.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: richmarl10
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend at Villa, clean, nice, and relaxing. Staying by the bar could be a problem, but the room we got was away from the bar so it was just perfect. The bathroom is very small, but clean. The bar is lots of fun if your looking for a party place. The local area restaurant's had great food at a reasonable price. They are losing alot of beach, due to the storms, so their might not be too much beach left within the next couple of years. The staff were very nice and helpful. I would stay again...

Reviews.Title: “We love The Villa Cofresi, you will too!”
Reviews.Author: 1030ben
Reviews.Content: We love the Villa Cofresi. We were married here three years ago. Recently we had the pleasure of spending an entire week at The Villa for our third anniversary. Our two year old and four month old came too. The location right on the beach and the sunsets make it special. Our two year old loved the pool. As soon as you arrive go to the bar and have a Pirata, The Villa's signature cocktail. We enjoy the mix of Puerto Ricans and Gringos here. Some areas of Rincon feel segregated, all Gringo or all Puerto Rican, The Villa has a nice mix. The staff was wonderful. When our infant had a fever the owner arranged for us to see a doctor and be in and out without spending the whole day which is the norm in PR. If you want to go to bed early be sure to request a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: NaptownJetSet
Reviews.Content: We selected Villa Cofresi based on reviews here and for its location and price. In the end, we were not disappointed, although we did find it to be a bit rough around the edges (dirty carpets, old furniture) and quite loud at times (even though we were in PR during a relatively low season). The noise stems from the fact the this hotel has a bar right in the center of its main courtyard area, and noise rise up to all rooms from there. The bar is nicely located for guests, but also seems to be the main bar on the beach, and thus most of the clientele are not staying at the hotel and it is active all day long (sunsets are great from here, so no surprise there). I awoke one Sunday morning at 9 am to the sounds of Michael Jackson. The next day, a Monday, we were awaken at 7:30 am, when the maintenance staff decided to begin work on replacing some tile (ie, construction work). I prefer to sleep a little later when I am on vacation and after having listened to the jukebox until 1 am the night before. On the plus side, there are some suitable restaurants within walking distance (try Rincon Tropical for seafood, and Cerdito del Cielito for some very good BBQ). The bar makes excellent mojitos and charges on $3 for a cold beer). The bar is right next to the small beach, which is protected enough to be excellent for swimming. There is also a small but very clean swimming pool. Also, the Cofresi largely caters to a Puerto Rican guest base and we found this to be a plus. The breakfast is one of the less inviting I have had but at least there is something available. For the price - we paid $155 for a room with ocean view and balcony on the third floor - this is a decent enough place. We would certainly stay here again, but would not look forward to the heavy traffic congestion that you will encounter as you return to San Juan (the worst traffic we experienced during our trip around the island).

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Returning”
Reviews.Author: PR3ofus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in Sept '08 with our daughter, celebrating her 15th bday, our cousin, celebrating his 21st bday. We had a great time with the bartenders! Chichi will definitely make you laugh. Sunsets are AMAZING!! Rooms are clean and hotel grounds are well-kept. Food is incredible from the bar/grill and their restaurant! Just as the title states....we are returning February 09 and bringing more new guests with us to experience this incredible, homey beach hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Catzeyes28
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times, In fact we were married there on the beach 4 years ago. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a way to truly experience the real Puerto Rico. The deluxe rooms are huge and the private balcony is wonderful. The food served at both the pool bar and the restaurant is a great value and very well prepared . As for reading other reviews both myself and my family were not treated as gringos but welcomed by all staff who went out of their to be helpful and friendly. Sandra who was in charge of our wedding and reception was fantastic to deal with. You can't ask for nicer people and Rincon is a lovely place to vacation.

Reviews.Title: “First time at Villa Cofresi...but not the last time”
Reviews.Author: linzee32
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at Villa Cofresi and probably won't be my last. This was a business trip, we were attending a career fair at the University of Puerto Rico-Mayaguez. My boss and I shared one of the deluxe rooms. It was spacious to say the least and had a great view. We had two king size beds in our room. Continental breakfast was included but unfortunately we had to be out of the room for work before it was served each day, we were told they would bring a bag of food to our room but it never showed up. We were also sad that we never got to use the pool because it was only open between 10 and 7, we did not return to the hotel until 8 each night. The tiki bar was awesome, bartenders were great. Never a long wait for a drink. My coworkers enjoyed "the pirate" but it was not my thing.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: ASDASD79
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is true. We stayed here for four days and not only contracted bed bugs the last night we were there, we brought them home. I am a very clean person and also a doctor, so I know what I am talking about. I contacted Rita Caro when I got home to let her know, she said she did not think this was their problem but would get back to me. Well, she never called me back and so I feel I gave them a chance to rectify the situation - 5 months in fact. But now that I think about the expensive exterminator and dry cleaning bills, I think others who consider staying here should be fairly warned. If you don't mind the possibility of bed bugs, and are looking for a cheap, casual place with loud music on the beach, this place is for me. As for me, I will definitely not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Caution - Not a Quiet Retreat”
Reviews.Author: H&H-Hacienda
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here four nights in June. Our third floor room was clean, well maintained and comfortable with a large balcony on the beach (located in a separate building to the south of the main hotel building. The hotel staff was polite and efficient but not exactly friendly. The hotel guests are almost exclusively Puerto Ricans and its a great place for families with young children and teens alike. However, the noise from the bar every night until midnight and then noise from guests on the beach until 3:00 am was ridiculously loud. Despite using ear plugs, having the air-conditioner fan on high and leaving the TV on, the outside noise made evenings miserable. Why not join in the fun, you ask. Well, the locals aren't exactly friendly to 'gringos'. Our first night we went to the bar and sat right at the bar. The bartender waited on everyone else, walked by us several times without so much as acknowledging our presence, waited on newcomers and then finally, when he decided we weren't going to leave, acted surprised to see us and took our drink order. Took him another 10 minutes to bring us two cold beers. We thought it was just the bartender's attitude, but after four days it was pretty obvious (because of other incidents) that our gringo presence was not welcome at this locals resort. The onsite restaurant serves a good variety of good food for dinner and the free breakfast (mostly carbs) was well presented and fresh. If you are looking for a good family resort on a great swimming beach, you'll love this place. If you're looking for a quiet beach resort, best look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to Relax and have fun!!”
Reviews.Author: Boricuajc
Reviews.Content: We drove from San Juan Airport directly to Rincon to start our Puerto Rico vacation. We arrived at around 12:30PM and even though it wasn't check in time, the staff was able to accommodate our situation and allowed us to check in early. Hotel Cofresi has that older hotel feel but is maintained and staffed at a high level. The hotel is located right on the beach and has a medium size pool that was kept very clean. When I was there it was staffed by a lifeguard. My room was clean and well decorated with teak type furniture. From my room balcony I had a clear view of the beach and ocean. An incredible sight at sunrise. The best part of the hotel has to be the bar, right by the beach. The bartenders/ grill cook are amazing. The night I was there, the bartenders kept providing me with cold Medella, even though the bar was packed. The bartenders were very knowledgeable of the area and even directed me to a nearby restaurant, where I had the best Chijo fish I have ever tasted. Overall the Hotel and staff were outstanding. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Like your most comfortable old shoes”
Reviews.Author: PCmonkey
Reviews.Content: We are long-time fans of this family-operated hotel (but it's more like a big home). There are many repeat guests who look forward to seeing one another year after year. The staff could not be more accommodating - any request gets their best effort. We think this place is best for an extended stay because each annual visit benefits from discovering what's that season's best feature (restaurant, site to visit, etc.). There is a personality component in the reactions to this place. If you want luxury, gambling and wearing jewels to dinner, go to San Juan -- this place is much too laid back for you.
